blog.name: whalohs
blog.title: wander, wonder.
blog.description: ( j. she/her. i spend all my time overanalyzing critical role. )

summary: maybe i’m making a mountain out of a molehill but i’ve seen a LOT of different opinions on Jester’s on the latest ep and i want...
body:
maybe i’m making a mountain out of a molehill but i’ve seen a LOT of different opinions on Jester’s on the latest ep and i want organize my own thoughts into a tumblr post ( and then throwing it into the tag ). this definitely never backfired on someone at all.

anyway this got long so putting it in a cut!! i’d love to discuss this with people too, as long as you’re ultimately okay with agreeing to disagree if we have to.

  • jester’s arc has never been, and won’t be, centered around fjord.
    • characters are absolutely allowed to have relationships with other characters that are impactful, and that’s absolutely the case here!! jester’s arc is centered around the growth of someone who has never seen the world before. jester’s relationship with fjord is special because before anything, jester’s first mortal friend was our lovely halforc!! he’s the one who kickstarted everything. 
    • but fjord’s fate does not, in fact, dictate jester’s fate. jester will learn a lot from this fascinating dynamic, and will ( hopefully ) learn to handle her relationships in a mature manner without idealizing them.
      • as an aside: it’s perfectly okay for things to not turn out this way! no character’s development has to be healthy, this is fiction and the point of fiction is to explore ideas that won’t always come true in real life. i would personally love to see a jester that takes traveler’s advice on enchanting fjord to love her, and see the consequences of that. i get why that wouldn’t be fun for other people, but the beauty of this not being real is that anything can happen. and i think that’s great!
    • while she did initially follow fjord because she’s easily distracted and he’s interesting, she is, again, out on her own journey to experience the world for herself. fjord could die tomorrow and jester would be very, very sad, but her story will continue on. she’ll explore the equally interesting relationships she has with caleb, or beau, or nott, or caduceus, or yasha, or her mother, or the traveler, or – you get my point. she will learn that the world isn’t as black and white as she made it out to be.
  • it’s 100% okay to be naive, but jester isn’t also a child. 
    • my girl!! my daughter!!! she’s wonderful because for how clueless she is in some aspects, she’s so wise in others. i love her because for all the insight she has that most people don’t have ( how to read people, how to react in certain ways to pull reactions from people, s e x ), she is blind in ways that most people aren’t. 
    • it’s okay to be naive - everyone is, in some way or another, naive, because we’re not going to experience everything life has to offer by the time we become adults. jester’s naivete isn’t something to deny or be written down as a negative trait because there is nothing wrong with being naive. 
    • important distinction: jester is extremely childish. just look at her argument with caleb, the way that she constantly asks for validation, how upset she gets when there’s a hint of abandonment from someone she cares about. but this and her naivete doesn’t make her a child. she’s still a healthy adult capable of making her own informed decisions and responsible for her own consequences. she is absolutely allowed to pursue relationships, romantic or otherwise, and shouldn’t ever be discouraged from doing so.
  • jester is still growing!
    • she lived her ENTIRE LIFE IN A ROOM SHE NEVER REALLY LEFT. her only form of human interaction was a mother who loved her dearly and a deity that we still don’t know a whole lot about. that was it. of course she’s going to need to grow!
    • and let’s be honest expecting her to have her shit together in any shape or form IS UNREALISTIC so early ( she literally did not understand the concept of money until episode?? 15?? ) into the campaign when she hasn’t had the chance to meet actual resistance
    • this also brings up an important point: i don’t actually think all of jester’s actions are healthy. but expecting them all to be healthy isn’t productive, and neither is demanding healthy actions / relationships from her and the people she connects with. 
      • again! the reason i’m such a huge fan of this is because this isn’t actually real. exploring this kind of personality in a safe space is literally things like D&D was made for!!! and especially for the critical role cast, who i can trust to delve into the Not Healthy character traits and explore it in really interesting ways, i’m just excited to see where it’ll go.
    • the point is i want her to learn all of these things and experience all the things she never had the chance to and WATCH HER GROW!! SHE HAS SO MUCH POTENTIAL!!
  • bonus round: idk if i actually want someone to tell jester all these things or if i want her to just… slowly mature naturally with her own realisations or if i want her to just TIP THE OTHER WAY, all these possibilities are SO INTERESTING TO ME

wow this got long

summary: THERE ARE JUST OVER 24 HOURS TO GET YOUR NOMINATIONS IN! Nominations close TOMORROW, November the 10th at 4pm EST! Make sure...
caption:
THERE ARE JUST OVER 24 HOURS TO GET YOUR NOMINATIONS IN!

Nominations close TOMORROW, November the 10th at 4pm EST!

Make sure that your favorite characters and ships are included in this rounds tag set!

There are currently 186 individual characters and groups in the tag set.

To see what is included in the tag set so far I have compiled and easy to read list which you can see here.

To Submit new nominations you want to go HERE
